examples: Our old friend, the DSM V, actually delineates two sub types of the disorder.
So because this giant space hosts the dining room, living room, and the kitchen, we have to delineate the three spaces very clearly.
Although they were rather arbitrarily defined in ancient times, today we recognize 88 official constellations, and their boundaries are carefully delineated on the sky.
EKATERINA SCHULMANN - It happened exactly because of the reasons that I have just delineated.
There's very little to, I guess, delineate the LCD itself from the rest of that little bezel.
words.defineEn: to give an explanation or depiction in full detail
words.defineVi: để đưa ra một lời giải thích hoặc mô tả đầy đủ chi tiết

examples: Once a clear delineation between master and servant, the human pet relationship has changed significantly over the last 30 years and brought humans and animals far closer together.

And at the same time, the governments of those same countries were supporting what they considered more moderate rebels, but again there aren't really clear delineations between some of these groups, and some of that money sloshed around and nobody was really too worried about where it was going, or they didn't monitor it carefully enough, and some of that money also got to ISIS.
words.defineEn: a graphic or vivid verbal description
words.defineVi: một mô tả bằng lời nói bằng hình ảnh hoặc sống động

words.defineEn: (meteorology) an isogram connecting points having equal barometric pressure at a given time
words.defineVi: (khí tượng học) biểu đồ nối các điểm có áp suất khí quyển bằng nhau tại một thời điểm nhất định

words.defineEn: equal in duration or interval
words.defineVi: bằng nhau về thời lượng hoặc khoảng thời gian

examples: When the pandemic hit, many people went to ground and isolated themselves at home to avoid getting sick.
The breakup with his long-term partner caused him to fall to pieces and isolate himself from others.
Truculent Trump twists in the wind as an isolated, ridiculed figure of fun.
And in 1976, researchers isolated one of its DNA polymerases.
They isolate.
words.defineEn: place or set apart
words.defineVi: đặt hoặc đặt riêng

words.defineEn: of a process or change taking place at constant temperature
words.defineVi: của một quá trình hoặc thay đổi diễn ra ở nhiệt độ không đổi

examples: And then the fact that like, you know, we’d worked really hard on certain things, that the stridency of the opposition went way beyond what I knew the other people actually thought.
words.defineEn: having the timbre of a loud high-pitched sound
words.defineVi: có âm sắc của một âm thanh the thé lớn

examples: The rhetoric of Black Power could be strident, but its message of black empowerment was deeply resonant for many.
And, of course, they have been strident in their opposition to the Biden administration.
And if you go back and reread the transcript of his answer to me on this, as I did recently, it was very strident.
Bibi's father believed he was forced to leave Israel because of his strident right-wing politics.
We should say, these groups predate President Trump, but they have now become some of his most strident backers, and are willing to commit this kind of violence in his name.
words.defineEn: unpleasantly loud and harsh
words.defineVi: khó chịu ồn ào và khắc nghiệt

examples: She carefully collected the nectar from the blooming flowers to make a delicious homemade honey.
They watched as the bees buzzed around, sipping the nectar from the colorful blossoms.
In return, the flowers make nectar!
And this nectar attracts the local mountain tree shrews, big-eyed rodents about 18 centimeters in length.
Most flowers make sugary nectar, too.
words.defineEn: a sweet, liquid substance produced by flowers and used by insects as a source of energy
words.defineVi: một chất lỏng, ngọt do hoa tạo ra và được côn trùng sử dụng làm nguồn năng lượng

examples: Nectarines can be used in various culinary creations, from pies and tarts to jams and chutneys.
They carefully extracted the stone from the nectarine, savoring the velvety flesh around it.
The vibrant orange color of a ripe nectarine is so appealing.
I love biting into a juicy nectarine on a hot summer day.
But whether your favorite meal includes noodles or nectarines, tortillas or tofu, most types of food have some of what our bodies need to stay healthy.
words.defineEn: a peach-like fruit with smooth yellow and red skin
words.defineVi: một loại trái cây giống như quả đào với vỏ màu vàng và đỏ mịn

words.defineEn: something hard to endure
words.defineVi: một cái gì đó khó khăn để chịu đựng

examples: She casted aspersions on the integrity of her boss.
He tried to avoid casting aspersions on his political opponents.
words.defineEn: an abusive attack on a person's character or good name
words.defineVi: một cuộc tấn công lạm dụng vào nhân vật của một người hoặc tên tốt

examples: Although they struggled to make ends meet, the Johnsons took pride in their children's academic achievements and aspirations.
The college's aim is to help students achieve their aspirations.
For some people, a high-paying job is the be-all and end-all of their career aspirations.
They have humungous aspirations.
That puff of air is called aspiration.
words.defineEn: a strong will to achieve something
words.defineVi: một ý chí mạnh mẽ để đạt được một cái gì đó

examples: Acting classes help aspiring actors develop their skills and techniques.
While some people may aspire to work for a large corporation, others may prefer to work for a smaller company where they can have more control and authority.
The siren call of fame and fortune lured many aspiring actors to Hollywood.
He caught a break that few aspiring screenwriters do: running into a studio boss at a party.
Despite facing rejection after rejection, the aspiring writer kept writing and eventually published a successful book, demonstrating that you cannot keep a good man down.
words.defineEn: to desire to have or become something
words.defineVi: để mong muốn có hoặc trở thành một cái gì đó

examples: This tenacious beetle has dug in.
Well, Stephen was tenacious.
Then the spider switches to a sticky silk for its main motif: circle after circle of tenacious thread.
Every continent, that is, except for Australia, whose southern wilds were still home to the tenacious Koolasuchus.
She was active and tenacious, an inspiration to her children and grandchildren.
words.defineEn: good at remembering
words.defineVi: ghi nhớ tốt

examples: I can admire the tenacity.
I think watching dad early on, was his stamina, his tenacity, his over-effort.
From confinement to liberation, from winter to spring, and aptly, it's a holiday that celebrates tenacity and resilience in the times of overwhelming adversity.

She was an especially powerful role model for young women and girls, who admired her integrity, her tenacity and her intellect, and for whom she blazed a trail as one-half of the first all-female anchor team on network news.
Did he misunderstand the tenacity of those that were in power, now really in power of the Republican Party?
words.defineEn: the quality or trait of being persistent, determined, and unwilling to give up, especially in the face of challenges or obstacles
words.defineVi: phẩm chất hoặc đặc điểm của sự kiên trì, quyết tâm và không muốn từ bỏ, đặc biệt là khi đối mặt với những thách thức hoặc trở ngại

words.defineEn: affect with, or as if with, jaundice
words.defineVi: ảnh hưởng với, hoặc như thể với, vàng da

words.defineEn: showing or affected by prejudice or envy or distaste
words.defineVi: hiển thị hoặc bị ảnh hưởng bởi thành kiến hoặc ghen tị hoặc chán ghét

examples: - We took a little trip down the snack isle.
Then he said, I also need socks and I said two isles over, next to the gel candles.
His son Telemachus and his wife Penelope don’t know if he’s dead or alive, but Homer reveals that he’s on the Isle of Ogygia.
And then I go on stage and be funny about the stuff at night, cut between the two and in Scotland they have a thing like Stonehenge, it's on the Isle of Orkney, it's just stones, you know?
words.defineEn: a small island
words.defineVi: một hòn đảo nhỏ
